55static char *pidfile = NULL;
56static char *lockfile = NULL;
57static int devnullfd = -1;
58static int singletonfd = -1;
59
60#ifndef ISC_FACILITY
61#define ISC_FACILITY LOG_DAEMON
62#endif
63
64static struct passwd *runas_pw = NULL;
65static bool done_setuid = false;
66static int dfd[2] = { -1, -1 };
67
68#ifdef HAVE_SYS_CAPABILITY_H
69
70static bool non_root = false;
71static bool non_root_caps = false;
72
73#include <sys/capability.h>
74#include <sys/prctl.h>
75
76static void
77linux_setcaps(cap_t caps) {
78 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
79
80 if ((getuid() != 0 && !non_root_caps) || non_root) {
81 return;
82 }
83 if (cap_set_proc(caps) < 0) {
84 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
85 named_main_earlyfatal("cap_set_proc() failed: %s:"
86 " please ensure that the capset kernel"
87 " module is loaded. see insmod(8)",
88 strbuf);
89 }
90}
91
92#define SET_CAP(flag) \
93 do { \
94 cap_flag_value_t curval; \
95 capval = (flag); \
96 err = cap_get_flag(curcaps, capval, CAP_PERMITTED, &curval); \
97 if (err != -1 && curval) { \
98 err = cap_set_flag(caps, CAP_EFFECTIVE, 1, &capval, CAP_SET); \
99 if (err == -1) { \
100 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf)); \
101 named_main_earlyfatal("cap_set_proc failed: %s", strbuf); \
102 } \
103 \
104 err = cap_set_flag(caps, CAP_PERMITTED, 1, &capval, CAP_SET); \
105 if (err == -1) { \
106 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf)); \
107 named_main_earlyfatal("cap_set_proc failed: %s", strbuf); \
108 } \
109 } \
110 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
111#define INIT_CAP \
112 do { \
113 caps = cap_init(); \
114 if (caps == NULL) { \
115 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf)); \
116 named_main_earlyfatal("cap_init failed: %s", strbuf); \
117 } \
118 curcaps = cap_get_proc(); \
119 if (curcaps == NULL) { \
120 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf)); \
121 named_main_earlyfatal("cap_get_proc failed: %s", strbuf); \
122 } \
123 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
124#define FREE_CAP \
125 { \
126 cap_free(caps); \
127 cap_free(curcaps); \
128 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
129
130static void
131linux_initialprivs(void) {
132 cap_t caps;
133 cap_t curcaps;
134 cap_value_t capval;
135 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
136 int err;
137
138 /*%
139 * We don't need most privileges, so we drop them right away.
140 * Later on linux_minprivs() will be called, which will drop our
141 * capabilities to the minimum needed to run the server.
142 */
143 INIT_CAP;
144
145 /*
146 * We need to be able to bind() to privileged ports, notably port 53!
147 */
148 SET_CAP(CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE);
149
150 /*
151 * We need chroot() initially too.
152 */
153 SET_CAP(CAP_SYS_CHROOT);
154
155 /*
156 * We need setuid() as the kernel supports keeping capabilities after
157 * setuid().
158 */
159 SET_CAP(CAP_SETUID);
160
161 /*
162 * Since we call initgroups, we need this.
163 */
164 SET_CAP(CAP_SETGID);
165
166 /*
167 * Without this, we run into problems reading a configuration file
168 * owned by a non-root user and non-world-readable on startup.
169 */
170 SET_CAP(CAP_DAC_READ_SEARCH);
171
172 /*
173 * XXX We might want to add CAP_SYS_RESOURCE, though it's not
174 * clear it would work right given the way linuxthreads work.
175 * XXXDCL But since we need to be able to set the maximum number
176 * of files, the stack size, data size, and core dump size to
177 * support named.conf options, this is now being added to test.
178 */
179 SET_CAP(CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
180
181 /*
182 * We need to be able to set the ownership of the containing
183 * directory of the pid file when we create it.
184 */
185 SET_CAP(CAP_CHOWN);
186
187 linux_setcaps(caps);
188
189 FREE_CAP;
190}
191
192static void
193linux_minprivs(void) {
194 cap_t caps;
195 cap_t curcaps;
196 cap_value_t capval;
197 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
198 int err;
199
200 INIT_CAP;
201 /*%
202 * Drop all privileges except the ability to bind() to privileged
203 * ports.
204 *
205 * It's important that we drop CAP_SYS_CHROOT. If we didn't, it
206 * chroot() could be used to escape from the chrooted area.
207 */
208
209 SET_CAP(CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE);
210
211 /*
212 * XXX We might want to add CAP_SYS_RESOURCE, though it's not
213 * clear it would work right given the way linuxthreads work.
214 * XXXDCL But since we need to be able to set the maximum number
215 * of files, the stack size, data size, and core dump size to
216 * support named.conf options, this is now being added to test.
217 */
218 SET_CAP(CAP_SYS_RESOURCE);
219
220 linux_setcaps(caps);
221
222 FREE_CAP;
223}
224
225static void
226linux_keepcaps(void) {
227 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
228 /*%
229 * Ask the kernel to allow us to keep our capabilities after we
230 * setuid().
231 */
232
233 if (prctl(PR_SET_KEEPCAPS, 1, 0, 0, 0) < 0) {
234 if (errno != EINVAL) {
235 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
236 named_main_earlyfatal("prctl() failed: %s", strbuf);
237 }
238 } else {
239 non_root_caps = true;
240 if (getuid() != 0)
241 non_root = true;
242 }
243}
244
245#endif /* HAVE_SYS_CAPABILITY_H */
246
247static void
248setup_syslog(const char *progname) {
249 int options;
250
251 options = LOG_PID;
252#ifdef LOG_NDELAY
253 options |= LOG_NDELAY;
254#endif
255 openlog(isc_file_basename(progname), options, ISC_FACILITY);
256}
257
258void
259named_os_init(const char *progname) {
260 setup_syslog(progname);
261#ifdef HAVE_SYS_CAPABILITY_H
262 linux_initialprivs();
263#endif
264#ifdef SIGXFSZ
265 signal(SIGXFSZ, SIG_IGN);
266#endif
267}
268
269void
270named_os_daemonize(void) {
271 pid_t pid;
272 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
273
274 if (pipe(dfd) == -1) {
275 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
276 named_main_earlyfatal("pipe(): %s", strbuf);
277 }
278
279 pid = fork();
280 if (pid == -1) {
281 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
282 named_main_earlyfatal("fork(): %s", strbuf);
283 }
284 if (pid != 0) {
285 int n;
286 /*
287 * Wait for the child to finish loading for the first time.
288 * This would be so much simpler if fork() worked once we
289 * were multi-threaded.
290 */
291 (void)close(dfd[1]);
292 do {
293 char buf;
294 n = read(dfd[0], &buf, 1);
295 if (n == 1)
296 _exit(0);
297 } while (n == -1 && errno == EINTR);
298 _exit(1);
299 }
300 (void)close(dfd[0]);
301
302 /*
303 * We're the child.
304 */
305
306 if (setsid() == -1) {
307 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
308 named_main_earlyfatal("setsid(): %s", strbuf);
309 }
310
311 /*
312 * Try to set stdin, stdout, and stderr to /dev/null, but press
313 * on even if it fails.
314 *
315 * XXXMLG The close() calls here are unneeded on all but NetBSD, but
316 * are harmless to include everywhere. dup2() is supposed to close
317 * the FD if it is in use, but unproven-pthreads-0.16 is broken
318 * and will end up closing the wrong FD. This will be fixed eventually,
319 * and these calls will be removed.
320 */
321 if (devnullfd != -1) {
322 if (devnullfd != STDIN_FILENO) {
323 (void)close(STDIN_FILENO);
324 (void)dup2(devnullfd, STDIN_FILENO);
325 }
326 if (devnullfd != STDOUT_FILENO) {
327 (void)close(STDOUT_FILENO);
328 (void)dup2(devnullfd, STDOUT_FILENO);
329 }
330 if (devnullfd != STDERR_FILENO && !named_g_keepstderr) {
331 (void)close(STDERR_FILENO);
332 (void)dup2(devnullfd, STDERR_FILENO);
333 }
334 }
335}
336
337void
338named_os_started(void) {
339 char buf = 0;
340
341 /*
342 * Signal to the parent that we started successfully.
343 */
344 if (dfd[0] != -1 && dfd[1] != -1) {
345 if (write(dfd[1], &buf, 1) != 1)
346 named_main_earlyfatal("unable to signal parent that we "
347 "otherwise started "
348 "successfully.");
349 close(dfd[1]);
350 dfd[0] = dfd[1] = -1;
351 }
352}
353
354void
355named_os_opendevnull(void) {
356 devnullfd = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR, 0);
357}
358
359void
360named_os_closedevnull(void) {
361 if (devnullfd != STDIN_FILENO &&
362 devnullfd != STDOUT_FILENO &&
363 devnullfd != STDERR_FILENO) {
364 close(devnullfd);
365 devnullfd = -1;
366 }
367}
368
369static bool
370all_digits(const char *s) {
371 if (*s == '\0')
372 return (false);
373 while (*s != '\0') {
374 if (!isdigit((*s)&0xff))
375 return (false);
376 s++;
377 }
378 return (true);
379}
380
381void
382named_os_chroot(const char *root) {
383 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
384#ifdef HAVE_LIBSCF
385 named_smf_chroot = 0;
386#endif
387 if (root != NULL) {
388#ifdef HAVE_CHROOT
389 if (chroot(root) < 0) {
390 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
391 named_main_earlyfatal("chroot(): %s", strbuf);
392 }
393#else
394 named_main_earlyfatal("chroot(): disabled");
395#endif
396 if (chdir("/") < 0) {
397 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
398 named_main_earlyfatal("chdir(/): %s", strbuf);
399 }
400#ifdef HAVE_LIBSCF
401 /* Set named_smf_chroot flag on successful chroot. */
402 named_smf_chroot = 1;
403#endif
404 }
405}
406
407void
408named_os_inituserinfo(const char *username) {
409 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
410 if (username == NULL)
411 return;
412
413 if (all_digits(username))
414 runas_pw = getpwuid((uid_t)atoi(username));
415 else
416 runas_pw = getpwnam(username);
417 endpwent();
418
419 if (runas_pw == NULL)
420 named_main_earlyfatal("user '%s' unknown", username);
421
422 if (getuid() == 0) {
423 if (initgroups(runas_pw->pw_name, runas_pw->pw_gid) < 0) {
424 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
425 named_main_earlyfatal("initgroups(): %s", strbuf);
426 }
427 }
428
429}
430
431void
432named_os_changeuser(void) {
433 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
434 if (runas_pw == NULL || done_setuid)
435 return;
436
437 done_setuid = true;
438
439 if (setgid(runas_pw->pw_gid) < 0) {
440 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
441 named_main_earlyfatal("setgid(): %s", strbuf);
442 }
443
444 if (setuid(runas_pw->pw_uid) < 0) {
445 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
446 named_main_earlyfatal("setuid(): %s", strbuf);
447 }
448
449#if defined(HAVE_SYS_CAPABILITY_H)
450 /*
451 * Restore the ability of named to drop core after the setuid()
452 * call has disabled it.
453 */
454 if (prctl(PR_SET_DUMPABLE,1,0,0,0) < 0) {
455 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
456 named_main_earlywarning("prctl(PR_SET_DUMPABLE) failed: %s",
457 strbuf);
458 }
459
460 linux_minprivs();
461#endif
462}
463
464uid_t
465ns_os_uid(void) {
466 if (runas_pw == NULL)
467 return (0);
468 return (runas_pw->pw_uid);
469}
470
471void
472named_os_adjustnofile(void) {
473#if defined(__linux__)
474 isc_result_t result;
475 isc_resourcevalue_t newvalue;
476
477 /*
478 * Linux: max number of open files specified by one thread doesn't seem
479 * to apply to other threads on Linux.
480 */
481 newvalue = ISC_RESOURCE_UNLIMITED;
482
483 result = isc_resource_setlimit(isc_resource_openfiles, newvalue);
484 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
485 named_main_earlywarning("couldn't adjust limit on open files");
486#endif
487}
488
489void
490named_os_minprivs(void) {
491#if defined(HAVE_SYS_CAPABILITY_H)
492 linux_keepcaps();
493 named_os_changeuser();
494 linux_minprivs();
495#endif
496}
497
498static int
499safe_open(const char *filename, mode_t mode, bool append) {
500 int fd;
501 struct stat sb;
502
503 if (stat(filename, &sb) == -1) {
504 if (errno != ENOENT)
505 return (-1);
506 } else if ((sb.st_mode & S_IFREG) == 0) {
507 errno = EOPNOTSUPP;
508 return (-1);
509 }
510
511 if (append)
512 fd = open(filename, O_WRONLY|O_CREAT|O_APPEND, mode);
513 else {
514 if (unlink(filename) < 0 && errno != ENOENT)
515 return (-1);
516 fd = open(filename, O_WRONLY|O_CREAT|O_EXCL, mode);
517 }
518 return (fd);
519}
520
521static void
522cleanup_pidfile(void) {
523 int n;
524 if (pidfile != NULL) {
525 n = unlink(pidfile);
526 if (n == -1 && errno != ENOENT)
527 named_main_earlywarning("unlink '%s': failed", pidfile);
528 free(pidfile);
529 }
530 pidfile = NULL;
531}
532
533static void
534cleanup_lockfile(void) {
535 if (singletonfd != -1) {
536 close(singletonfd);
537 singletonfd = -1;
538 }
539
540 if (lockfile != NULL) {
541 int n = unlink(lockfile);
542 if (n == -1 && errno != ENOENT)
543 named_main_earlywarning("unlink '%s': failed",
544 lockfile);
545 free(lockfile);
546 lockfile = NULL;
547 }
548}
549
550/*
551 * Ensure that a directory exists.
552 * NOTE: This function overwrites the '/' characters in 'filename' with
553 * nulls. The caller should copy the filename to a fresh buffer first.
554 */
555static int
556mkdirpath(char *filename, void (*report)(const char *, ...)) {
557 char *slash = strrchr(filename, '/');
558 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
559 unsigned int mode;
560
561 if (slash != NULL && slash != filename) {
562 struct stat sb;
563 *slash = '\0';
564
565 if (stat(filename, &sb) == -1) {
566 if (errno != ENOENT) {
567 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
568 (*report)("couldn't stat '%s': %s", filename,
569 strbuf);
570 goto error;
571 }
572 if (mkdirpath(filename, report) == -1)
573 goto error;
574 /*
575 * Handle "//", "/./" and "/../" in path.
576 */
577 if (!strcmp(slash + 1, "") ||
578 !strcmp(slash + 1, ".") ||
579 !strcmp(slash + 1, "..")) {
580 *slash = '/';
581 return (0);
582 }
583 mode = S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IXUSR; /* u=rwx */
584 mode |= S_IRGRP | S_IXGRP; /* g=rx */
585 mode |= S_IROTH | S_IXOTH; /* o=rx */
586 if (mkdir(filename, mode) == -1) {
587 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
588 (*report)("couldn't mkdir '%s': %s", filename,
589 strbuf);
590 goto error;
591 }
592 if (runas_pw != NULL &&
593 chown(filename, runas_pw->pw_uid,
594 runas_pw->pw_gid) == -1) {
595 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
596 (*report)("couldn't chown '%s': %s", filename,
597 strbuf);
598 }
599 }
600 *slash = '/';
601 }
602 return (0);
603
604 error:
605 *slash = '/';
606 return (-1);
607}
608
609static void
610setperms(uid_t uid, gid_t gid) {
611#if defined(HAVE_SETEGID) || defined(HAVE_SETRESGID)
612 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
613#endif
614#if !defined(HAVE_SETEGID) && defined(HAVE_SETRESGID)
615 gid_t oldgid, tmpg;
616#endif
617#if !defined(HAVE_SETEUID) && defined(HAVE_SETRESUID)
618 uid_t olduid, tmpu;
619#endif
620#if defined(HAVE_SETEGID)
621 if (getegid() != gid && setegid(gid) == -1) {
622 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
623 named_main_earlywarning("unable to set effective "
624 "gid to %ld: %s",
625 (long)gid, strbuf);
626 }
627#elif defined(HAVE_SETRESGID)
628 if (getresgid(&tmpg, &oldgid, &tmpg) == -1 || oldgid != gid) {
629 if (setresgid(-1, gid, -1) == -1) {
630 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
631 named_main_earlywarning("unable to set effective "
632 "gid to %d: %s", gid, strbuf);
633 }
634 }
635#endif
636
637#if defined(HAVE_SETEUID)
638 if (geteuid() != uid && seteuid(uid) == -1) {
639 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
640 named_main_earlywarning("unable to set effective "
641 "uid to %ld: %s",
642 (long)uid, strbuf);
643 }
644#elif defined(HAVE_SETRESUID)
645 if (getresuid(&tmpu, &olduid, &tmpu) == -1 || olduid != uid) {
646 if (setresuid(-1, uid, -1) == -1) {
647 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
648 named_main_earlywarning("unable to set effective "
649 "uid to %d: %s", uid, strbuf);
650 }
651 }
652#endif
653}
654
655FILE *
656named_os_openfile(const char *filename, mode_t mode, bool switch_user) {
657 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE], *f;
658 FILE *fp;
659 int fd;
660
661 /*
662 * Make the containing directory if it doesn't exist.
663 */
664 f = strdup(filename);
665 if (f == NULL) {
666 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
667 named_main_earlywarning("couldn't strdup() '%s': %s",
668 filename, strbuf);
669 return (NULL);
670 }
671 if (mkdirpath(f, named_main_earlywarning) == -1) {
672 free(f);
673 return (NULL);
674 }
675 free(f);
676
677 if (switch_user && runas_pw != NULL) {
678 gid_t oldgid = getgid();
679 /* Set UID/GID to the one we'll be running with eventually */
680 setperms(runas_pw->pw_uid, runas_pw->pw_gid);
681
682 fd = safe_open(filename, mode, false);
683
684 /* Restore UID/GID to root */
685 setperms(0, oldgid);
686
687 if (fd == -1) {
688 fd = safe_open(filename, mode, false);
689 if (fd != -1) {
690 named_main_earlywarning("Required root "
691 "permissions to open "
692 "'%s'.", filename);
693 } else {
694 named_main_earlywarning("Could not open "
695 "'%s'.", filename);
696 }
697 named_main_earlywarning("Please check file and "
698 "directory permissions "
699 "or reconfigure the filename.");
700 }
701 } else {
702 fd = safe_open(filename, mode, false);
703 }
704
705 if (fd < 0) {
706 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
707 named_main_earlywarning("could not open file '%s': %s",
708 filename, strbuf);
709 return (NULL);
710 }
711
712 fp = fdopen(fd, "w");
713 if (fp == NULL) {
714 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
715 named_main_earlywarning("could not fdopen() file '%s': %s",
716 filename, strbuf);
717 }
718
719 return (fp);
720}
721
722void
723named_os_writepidfile(const char *filename, bool first_time) {
724 FILE *fh;
725 pid_t pid;
726 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
727 void (*report)(const char *, ...);
728
729 /*
730 * The caller must ensure any required synchronization.
731 */
732
733 report = first_time ? named_main_earlyfatal : named_main_earlywarning;
734
735 cleanup_pidfile();
736
737 if (filename == NULL)
738 return;
739
740 pidfile = strdup(filename);
741 if (pidfile == NULL) {
742 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
743 (*report)("couldn't strdup() '%s': %s", filename, strbuf);
744 return;
745 }
746
747 fh = named_os_openfile(filename, S_IRUSR|S_IWUSR|S_IRGRP|S_IROTH,
748 first_time);
749 if (fh == NULL) {
750 cleanup_pidfile();
751 return;
752 }
753 pid = getpid();
754 if (fprintf(fh, "%ld\n", (long)pid) < 0) {
755 (*report)("fprintf() to pid file '%s' failed", filename);
756 (void)fclose(fh);
757 cleanup_pidfile();
758 return;
759 }
760 if (fflush(fh) == EOF) {
761 (*report)("fflush() to pid file '%s' failed", filename);
762 (void)fclose(fh);
763 cleanup_pidfile();
764 return;
765 }
766 (void)fclose(fh);
767}
768
769bool
770named_os_issingleton(const char *filename) {
771 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
772 struct flock lock;
773
774 if (singletonfd != -1)
775 return (true);
776
777 if (strcasecmp(filename, "none") == 0)
778 return (true);
779
780 /*
781 * Make the containing directory if it doesn't exist.
782 */
783 lockfile = strdup(filename);
784 if (lockfile == NULL) {
785 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
786 named_main_earlyfatal("couldn't allocate memory for '%s': %s",
787 filename, strbuf);
788 } else {
789 int ret = mkdirpath(lockfile, named_main_earlywarning);
790 if (ret == -1) {
791 named_main_earlywarning("couldn't create '%s'",
792 filename);
793 cleanup_lockfile();
794 return (false);
795 }
796 }
797
798 /*
799 * named_os_openfile() uses safeopen() which removes any existing
800 * files. We can't use that here.
801 */
802 singletonfd = open(filename, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT,
803 S_IRUSR|S_IWUSR|S_IRGRP|S_IROTH);
804 if (singletonfd == -1) {
805 cleanup_lockfile();
806 return (false);
807 }
808
809 memset(&lock, 0, sizeof(lock));
810 lock.l_type = F_WRLCK;
811 lock.l_whence = SEEK_SET;
812 lock.l_start = 0;
813 lock.l_len = 1;
814
815 /* Non-blocking (does not wait for lock) */
816 if (fcntl(singletonfd, F_SETLK, &lock) == -1) {
817 close(singletonfd);
818 singletonfd = -1;
819 return (false);
820 }
821
822 return (true);
823}
824
825void
826named_os_shutdown(void) {
827 closelog();
828 cleanup_pidfile();
829 cleanup_lockfile();
830}
831
832isc_result_t
833named_os_gethostname(char *buf, size_t len) {
834 int n;
835
836 n = gethostname(buf, len);
837 return ((n == 0) ? ISC_R_SUCCESS : ISC_R_FAILURE);
838}
839
840void
841named_os_shutdownmsg(char *command, isc_buffer_t *text) {
842 char *last, *ptr;
843 pid_t pid;
844
845
846 /* Skip the command name. */
847 if ((ptr = strtok_r(command, " \t", &last)) == NULL) {
848 return;
849 }
850
851 if ((ptr = strtok_r(NULL, " \t", &last)) == NULL) {
852 return;
853 }
854
855 if (strcmp(ptr, "-p") != 0) {
856 return;
857 }
858
859 pid = getpid();
860
861 (void)isc_buffer_printf(text, "pid: %ld", (long)pid);
862}
863
864void
865named_os_tzset(void) {
866#ifdef HAVE_TZSET
867 tzset();
868#endif
869}
870
871static char unamebuf[BUFSIZ];
872static char *unamep = NULL;
873
874static void
875getuname(void) {
876#ifdef HAVE_UNAME
877 struct utsname uts;
878
879 memset(&uts, 0, sizeof(uts));
880 if (uname(&uts) < 0) {
881 snprintf(unamebuf, sizeof(unamebuf), "unknown architecture");
882 return;
883 }
884
885 snprintf(unamebuf, sizeof(unamebuf),
886 "%s %s %s %s",
887 uts.sysname, uts.machine, uts.release, uts.version);
888#else
889 snprintf(unamebuf, sizeof(unamebuf), "unknown architecture");
890#endif
891 unamep = unamebuf;
892}
893
894char *
895named_os_uname(void) {
896 if (unamep == NULL)
897 getuname();
898 return (unamep);
899}
